intro: Grossera paniculata, commonly known as the panicled grossera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its foliage is broad and lobed, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
